summary: This bill (S. 2300) amends Title 44 of the United States Code to restrict donations to Presidential Libraries and Centers. It defines key terms like "donation," "Presidential Library or Center," and restricted donor categories (e.g., lobbyists, foreign nationals, federal contractors).  The bill sets restrictions on who can donate and when, includes a cooling-off period after a president leaves office, establishes an aggregate donation limit, outlines reporting requirements, and provides for enforcement, including civil and criminal penalties, for violations. It also includes indexing for inflation of penalty amounts.
